result.execSummary:
The defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Tampering with a Global Positioning System Tracking Device, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.465.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Supervision under the Mental Health Unit. Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: Successfully complete an anger management course.
Absolute sobriety-no illegal drug or alcohol. Random screens. No contact with Angela B. unless approved by the probation agent.
Maintain employment as able. Obtain GED, HSED or diploma.

Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable court costs, surcharges and fees except for the DNA surcharge. Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Complete a mental health assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED until next court date.
***12-05-14, Judge Dallet, Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days, straight time, with no good time credit, for non-compliance with conditions of probation. FORTHWITH.***

charges.descr: Tampering with a Global Positioning System Tracking Device

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dallas Antwan Bailey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey not in court.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey in court with attorney Cynthia M. Wynn.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
*
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Court ordered defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, with 0 days credit for time served.
.
COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, STAYED, until next court date.
-Supervision under the Mental Health Unit.  Complete a mental health assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete an anger management course.
-AODA assessment and treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drug or alcohol.
-Random screens.
-No contact with Angela B. unless approved by the probation agent.
-Maintain employment as able.  
-Obtain GED, HSED or diploma.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable court costs, surcharges and fees except for the DNA surcharge.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Cynthia M. Wynn in court, defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey not in court, in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea hearing.  Parties are still negotiating and would like another date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey in court with attorney Cynthia M. Wynn.  Defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant has a pending matter before Judge Dallet, Branch 40 and that the Court has agreed to accept this matter as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case transferred to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
No contact with: as per case 14CM166 (Angela B.)

Defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey in court with attorney Alexis Liggins for attorney Cynthia M Wynn.  Defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.  Defense wishes to stipulate to report authored by Dawn M. Laurent, Psy.D.  Defendant indicates that he is competent.  There being no challenge to the report dated 6-30-14 by the state, defense counsel or defendant, the court found the defendant competent to proceed and ordered the proceedings reinstated.  Bail argument made by the state and defense.  Court sets cash bail.   Telephone conference set for 7-02-14 removed from the calendar at this time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
dated 6-30-14 authored by Dawn M. Laurent, Psy.D., filed.

Attorney Cynthia M Wynn in court, defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey not in court, in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Review Hearing.  Parties in receipt of report dated 6-13-14 authored by Dawn M. Laurent, Psy.D.  Dr. Laurent found the defendant competent to proceed.  Defense challenges this report on behalf of the defendant.  Clerk unable to schedule competency hearing on today due video technician and Dr. Laurent being unavailable at this time.  Matter to be set for the purpose of scheduling.  Filed, copy of Department of Health Services Report dated 6-13-14.  Telephone conference scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cynthia M. Wynn in court, defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Appearance of the defendant waived by defense.  Parties in receipt of report authored by Dr. Deborah Collins.  Defendant was committed to the Department of Health Services on today in Branch 40; defendant did not challenge the report.   There being no challenges to the report, the court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
  Review hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Report dated 3-28-14 authored by Dr. Deborah L. Collins, received and filed.

Defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Dallas Antwan Bailey in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
